comments.author: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text: In imglib we have some functions (LoadImage) in interfaces that addons have no business using, but are used by some of our tests. It would be nice we could only expose these interfaces in debug builds.
comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: In imglib we have some functions (LoadImage) in interfaces that addons have no business using, but are used by some of our tests. It would be nice we could only expose these interfaces in debug builds.

comments.author: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text: One approach is to have an attribute like [noscript]. e.g. [noscript-release] etc.
comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com

comments.creator: josh@joshmatthews.net
comments.text: What if the functions moved to a different interface that was implemented conditionally (NS_INTERFACE_MAP_ENTRY_CONDITIONAL)? Would that stop script from being able to access them?
comments.author: josh@joshmatthews.net
comments.raw_text: What if the functions moved to a different interface that was implemented conditionally (NS_INTERFACE_MAP_ENTRY_CONDITIONAL)? Would that stop script from being able to access them?

comments.text:
(In reply to Josh Matthews [:jdm] from comment #2)
> What if the functions moved to a different interface that was implemented
> conditionally (NS_INTERFACE_MAP_ENTRY_CONDITIONAL)? Would that stop script
> from being able to access them?

Well, native Gecko code needs to be able to call them.

My pie in the sky solution would be to rewrite the tests in C++.  No idea how painful that would be here.
